review: I own an Apple TV and the Amazon Fire TV. I love the games on the Amazon Fire and the options but I feel like they tried to hard on it and it over complicated the device. It has too much cluttered and it feels very under developed. Most of the apps are fun for the first hour and the really good ones you are shelling out an extra $5 for and then realize it's not even worth it. i would recommend the Apple TV

review: After being a cable TV subscriber for more years than I'd like to count, my wife and I decided to cut the cord and join our kids in the world of streaming TV. We have had Kindle Fires and Kindle Paperwhites for a while, so after reading the professional reviews of the systems available I decided to go with the Fire TV because of the processor and memory it has.We've only had it for a week, but we don't miss cable at all (except that tonight for some reason the local NBC station would not come in over the Leaf antenna I bought through Amazon -- not that that has anything to do with Fire TV -- so we had to watch the Nightly News delayed via their app on the Fire TV). Together with Amazon Prime this device gives us plenty of options for evening entertainment when we're not reading or playing games on our Kindles.The only thing I was missing was live sports, so I added Sling TV via an app on the Fire TV, and all is right with the world once again.We figure we'll recoup our outlays within 2 months and then save about $75 per month thereafter.
